newsitem.title: CHILE: CHILE DECLARES ONE MONTH ANCHOVY FISHING BAN.
newsitem.headline: CHILE DECLARES ONE MONTH ANCHOVY FISHING BAN.

text.p: Chile declared Friday a one month ban on anchovy fishing in its northern waters to protect the fish from the impact of the El Nino climatic phenomenon during the species' reproductive cycle.
"But as in other years, catches for human consumption to supply two preserving plants in Arica will be exempted," said the fisheries undersecretariat in a statement.
Anchovy and mackerel, which was also subject to temporary fishing bans this year, are mostly caught to make fishmeal.
The ban follows an indefinite prohibition on anchovy fishing imposed by Peruvian authorities last month.
The Chilean ban will come into force from August 15.
The fishing authorities said they imposed the restriction as the warm ocean currents produced by El Nino damage anchovy eggs and larvae.
